final_answer.precision_note: Inputs (2.00, 0.180, 0.220) are 3 s.f. Result given to 3 significant figures.

method: Calculate concentrations at equilibrium. [NO2] = moles / volume = 0.180 / 2.00 = 0.0900 mol dm-3. [N2O4] = moles / volume = 0.220 / 2.00 = 0.110 mol dm-3. Use the equilibrium constant expression Kc = [NO2]^2 / [N2O4]. Substitute values: Kc = (0.0900)^2 / 0.110 = 0.00810 / 0.110 = 0.073636... Rounding to 3 significant figures gives 0.0736.
checks: Powers in Kc expression applied correctly
